alert.note: Alert for Wahkiakum (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 4:37AM PST until December 05 at 7:41PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Nehalem River near Foss affecting Clatsop and Tillamook Counties. Siletz River at Siletz affecting Lincoln County. Trask River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Grays River at Covered Bridge near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. .Widespread rain has caused sudden rises along area rivers and feeding streams. Rain will persist through Wednesday. For the Nw Oregon / Sw Washington Coast...including Willapa, Naselle, Vernonia, Covered Bridge near Rosburg, Foss, Tillamook, Tillamook, Beaver, Siletz, Tidewater, Mapleton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grays River at Covered Bridge near Rosburg. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...Above 16.0 feet, expect major flooding of lowland areas and roads in the vicinity of Hwy 4 and Rosburg. Numerous road closures are likely. Some buildings in low areas near the river are threatened with flooding above this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM PST Tuesday was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this afternoon to 7.3 feet early Saturday morning. It will then rise to 8.9 feet early Sunday morning. It will fall to 7.4 feet Wednesday, December 13 then rise again. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM PST.
